fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.locale

Interface ITranslated

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICell, IEdgeProperty<T>, IPermission, ISource, ITextData

    public interface ITranslated
    Uniform interface for selecting localized display text, such as component or entity labels.

    Thread safety: implementations of the methods defined by this interface are required to be safe for concurrent access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    ILocaleService.getText(java.util.Locale, ITranslated)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getGlobalText()
      Gets fallback (neutral, invariant) text for when no suitable translation can be found.
      default String getLocalText(ILocalized localizedObject)
      Gets localized text for display for this object, based on the locale associated with the specified localized object, if defined.
      String getLocalText(Locale locale)
      Gets localized text for display for this object, if an exact match exists for the specified locale.
      Set<Locale> getTextLocales()
      Gets the set of locales for which text translations exist for this object.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextLocales

        Set<Locale> getTextLocales()
        Gets the set of locales for which text translations exist for this object.
        Returns:
        the set of locales. May be empty, but never null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ILocaleService.negotiateLocale(java.util.Locale, java.util.Collection), getLocalText(java.util.Locale), getLocalText(ILocalized), getGlobalText()

      • getLocalText

        String getLocalText(Locale locale)
        Gets localized text for display for this object, if an exact match exists for the specified locale. If the returned string is a formatting template, then the formatting must be applied by an external function, such as ILocaleService.getText(ILocalized, ITranslated).
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale used to select specific translation text, or null.
        Returns:
        the exact match for the specified locale (if specified) or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ILocaleService.negotiateLocale(java.util.Locale, java.util.Collection), getTextLocales(), getLocalText(ILocalized), getGlobalText()

      • getLocalText

        default String getLocalText(ILocalized localizedObject)
        Gets localized text for display for this object, based on the locale associated with the specified localized object, if defined. If the returned string is a formatting template, then the formatting must be applied by an external function, such as ILocaleService.getText(ILocalized, ITranslated).
        Parameters:
        localizedObject - the object providing the locale used to select specific translation text, or null. Note that the locale returned by the localizedObject may also be null.
        Returns:
        the exact match for the specified locale (if specified) or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IUser.getLocale(), ILocaleService.negotiateLocale(java.util.Locale, java.util.Collection), getTextLocales(), getLocalText(java.util.Locale), getGlobalText()

      • getGlobalText

        String getGlobalText()
        Gets fallback (neutral, invariant) text for when no suitable translation can be found.
        Returns:
        neutral invariant text representing this object. Never returns null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getLocalText(java.util.Locale), getLocalText(ILocalized)
